item.title: syntax highlighting in psql vim session
item.description: If you spend a lot of time using psql, you should definitely use the \e and \ef commands to edit queries and functions in VIM. \e [FILE] [LINE] edit the query buffer (or file) with external editor \ef [FUNCNAME [LINE]] edit function definition with external editor One annoyance is that, because the temporary file created doesn’t have a .sql extension, VIM doesn’t enable syntax highlighting. Here is a simple autocmd that will turn syntax highlighting on that match psql’s filename pattern:
